Details: Damage to all 3 blades
Title of the article: Bending with the wind

Details: 5 died & 4 injured workers
Title of the article: Death toll in China construction site accident rises to five

Details: The turbine came loose after bolts attaching it to the hub failed, but definitely not because of a collision, examination of the components has revealed. The interim report goes no further than to say that material fatigue was the cause of the incident.
Title of the article: ET 'not to blame'

Details: A 30m turbine near Coldingham was deliberately collapsed by its constructors, Maden Design and Build, after going out of control on Wednesday, 7 December, 2011.
Title of the article: Wind turbine safety

Details: The fallen wind turbine was supplying power to Western Reserve High School.
Title of the article: Wind turbine failure western reserve high school udner investigation

Details: A wind turbine blade came crashing to the ground  halting energy production at a small-scale wind farm southwest of Wyanet because of what may be a defective design.
Title of the article: Blade breaks off wind tower near Wyanet

Details: Winds were gusting up to 25 MPH in the area.
Title of the article: Wind turbine catches fire

Details: Collapse sparked a small fire at the base of the turbine.
Title of the article: Wind turbine collapses in Altona

Details: Total damage $760,000
Title of the article: Lightening strikes burns down wind turbine

Details: "Wind Turbine tower lost overboard".  Parts of a tower were lost overboard from a ship in the North Sea, on its way from Denmark to Lewis on the German-registered "Lass Moon".
Title of the article: Wind turbine tower lost overboard

Details: The homeowner was trying to install the generator himself.
Title of the article: Vanessa Skarski's account ıf her father's death on a small wind turbine

Details: The single most significant factor leading to the accident was STS' method of attaching the guy cables to the anchors. In fact, the guy cables were never directly attached to the guy anchors or the guy anchor turnbuckles. Instead, the guy cables were attached to a cam-actuated cable grip and they are not designed or intended for use where their ability to release under compression will endanger someone.
Title of the article: Steen Aagard's crippling fall

Details: Terry Mehrkam was struck by one of the blades after falling from a platform.
Title of the article: Lessons from the death f Terry Merkam

Details: A 25-year old technician fell inside a 100-meter tall Enercon E66 tower, struck his head, and died according to an account in a local German newspaper.
Title of the article: Man falls to death from E66 in Germany

Details: The blades of all ten turbines were repaired in the summer of 2009. One of them did not survive the first storm.
Title of the article: Scansano broken blade

Details: Bolt failures caused a wind turbine’s rotor and blades to fall from a tower.
Title of the article: Rugby wind turbine accident pegged to bolt failure

Details: The crane was working with luffing jib and Y-Guy boom support, the stresses were such that the boom buckled and broke with the boom nose and jib base coming down on the operators cab.
Title of the article: Wind farm accident

Details: An engineer has died and another classed as missing after a wind turbine made by China’s CSR caught fire in Inner Mongolia.
Title of the article: Update: One dead one  missing after China turbine blaze

Details: Turbine spins out of control during a storm, effectively explodes when one of the blades hits the tower.
Title of the article: Wind turbine breaks up in storm

Details: The incident occured when the arm of the 1,000-ton crane, toppled and fell down suddenly in a trial operation to lift a wind turbine. Five people were killed after being crushed beneath the crane.
Title of the article: Five killed during sinovel 5MW construction preparation

Details: The victim was cleaning inside the turbine’s tower and he unintentionally touched several electrical wires inside the turbine, resulting in a jolt of approximately 110 volts of electricity traveling through his body.
Title of the article: Man electrocuted while cleaning wind turbine in Solano County

Details: Two workers constructing a wind turbine tower were injured when a 60-foot section of the tower laying on the ground accidentally rolled on top of the men.
Title of the article: Workers suffer cracked pelvises when turbine tower rolls on them

Details: Man in his 20s suffered chest and pelvic injuries after being caught by a turbine blade at the wind farm.
Title of the article: Vestas says worker injured at Australia's Macarthur wind farm

Details: Man has died after falling nearly 60 feet from a wind turbine he was climbing in Osceola County.
Title of the article: Spirit lake man dies after falling from wind turbine

Details: The fatal accident occurred when a crane carrying a Micon nacelle stalled then toppled over.
Title of the article: Crane accident

Details: The turbine is one of only three prototypes without an automatic braking system which were installed in 1989," explains Stiesdal. "Only these three have just a manual brake with hydraulically operated air brakes on the blade tips." It appears a brake failure was the cause of the accident. The turbine over-speeded in winds of 15-20 m/s and one of the blades hit the tower, bringing the whole structure down.
Title of the article: One-off accident

Details: Blades from two early generation AWP 56/100 turbines in Tarifa fell off last month, sparking fears among neighbours about the safety of wind farms.
Title of the article: Blade accident was unusual

Details: A 750 kW model at the Le Portel Plage wind station near Boulogne. A blade problem is being put forward as the most likely reason why the turbine buckled at its centre section in the early hours of January 1.
Title of the article: Two turbines fall down in France

Details: An older 300 kW model was brought down by gusts of winds reaching 31 m/s (110 kmh) at Dunkirk on March 20. Early investigations have identified weak foundations as the cause.
Title of the article: Two turbines fall down in France

Details: The first Carter 300 kW turbine to have been erected in Britain crashed to the ground on the evening of March 12 in only moderate winds. A failed padlock, which locked the tilt-down tower's main pin into place, was the cause of the accident, claims Andy Gibbs, a former partner in Carter Wind Turbines Ltd of England, the UK arm of the American company.
Title of the article: Carter crash in Scotland

Details: The turbine ran out of control until the nacelle and rotor fell off the tower. Tip speed was measured at 663 kilometres per hour at the time of the accident, compared with a maximum limit of 289 kph.
Title of the article: Human error behind Nordex turbine failure

Details: The grid connected turbine was destroyed, along with control and monitoring equipment in an adjacent shed. The tubular tower experienced metal failure in a crack around its circumference about one centimetre above a weld,which connected a flange to the tower base.
Title of the article: Turbine toppled

Details: A Danish contractor working on a wind turbine fell to his death at FPL Energy's 30 MW Meyersdale wind farm, a facility installed just last year in Pennsylvania. Niels Otto Anderson Sjølander was working for Vestas Wind Systems and had just completed repairs on a NEG Micon 1.5 MW turbine when the turbine's blade unexpectedly turned.
Title of the article: Danish contractor dies in fall from turbine at FPL site

Details: On the morning of April 1, one of the experimental 300 kW Holec turbines lost its blades in strong winds, almost exactly a year after a similar accident.
Title of the article: Holec turbine lost its blades

Details: The worker fell while inside the tower of the Clipper Windpower 2.5MW Liberty turbine located at the Endeavor wind centre. Reports say he fell over 60 feet. The reasons behind the accident are unknown.
Title of the article: Wind farm worker killed inside Iowa wind turbine

Details: The 4 MW Hamilton Standard wind turbine in Wyoming self-destructed in a catastrophic accident last month and will not be repaired. The mammoth machine, the last of its generation and America's largest, had been operating at about 90% availability and was generating almost eight million kWh until the accident on January 14, says co-owner Glidden Doman.
Title of the article: Mammoth declared extinct

Details: The incident began when one of the three workers suffered an electric shock in the nacelle. The other two workers were badly injured from the resulting fire and died later in hospital.
Title of the article: Three wind turbine workers killed in Sionvel accident

Details: On a calm night in early October a blade fell off a 15 year old Belgian Windmaster 300 kW machine, one of five installed at Saint-Thégonnec and Pleyber-Christ in the Finistère département of northern France.
Title of the article: Wind opponents ake much of failures of old wind turbines

Details: A massive directional change in strong winds caused nine tonnes of nacelle to come crashing down from atop the prototype Windflow Technology turbine operating just outside Christchurch, fortunately missing the two engineers working at the base of the tower.
Title of the article: Nacelle on prototype wind turbine crashed down in high winds

Details: The incident happened at Europe's largest wind farm, Siemens said an examination of the broken blade revealed a "material defect in the laminate". The company said there could be the result of changes to the manufacturing process.
Title of the article: Siemens extends 2.3 Mw turbine investigation amid defect concern

Details: A 23 metre blade came off an eight-year-old V47 660 kW machine installed at Windpark Tuitjenhorn in the province of Noord-Holland. During the failure, which occurred on May 13 at 10 pm, a section of the blade landed on the nearby N245 road between the villages of Oudkarspel and Dirkshorn in the community of Harenkarspel. With the road quiet at that time of night, no one was hurt, but the road was closed for some time.
Title of the article: Blade thrown into public road

Details: A barge worth £50 million toppled into the sea and sank as it was being towed to the site of an offshore North Wales windfarm. The barge was carrying giant cranes set to carry out vital work at the windfarm when it was lost overboard and sank to the bottom of the Atlantic.
Title of the article: £50m windfarm barge sinks on way to North Wales

Details: The cause of the 3 p.m. blaze, which is burning out under controlled conditions, hasn’t been determined
Title of the article: Vestas wind turbine catches fire in Germany

Details: The incident is caused by a break in the foundation flange after an unauthorised welding. Vestas further says the accident, which caused only material damage, happened during a test of the turbine's emergency stop system.
Title of the article: Vestas 2 MW V80 failure blamed on faulty welding

Details: The wind farm, undergoing an overhaul when one of the turbines caught fire. Two maintenance personnel were in the nacelle eliminating frequency converter faults. Two engineers died.
Title of the article: CSR turbine fire kills two workers in Inner Mongolia

Details: The WKA 60 1.2 MW turbine on the island of Helgoland is to be dismantled after again being struck by lightning. Considerable damage was caused.
Title of the article: KWA 60 to be dismantled

Details: A 46-metre blade has fallen off a Repower 2MW turbine at a project alongside the A10 motorway
Title of the article: Blade snaps off repower 2 MW motorway turbine

Details: When the blades were being removed the entire nacelle fell to the ground

Details: At the time of the collapse, in which the turbine tipped over from its base, winds were 20 m/s and the machine was switched off
Title of the article: Unknown cause of Siemens turbine collapse at Iwaya wind farm

Details: The 38.8m (127 ft) blade, weighing over 7 tons, broke up at high speed in a gale, throwing debris for a considerable distance.
Title of the article: Catastrophic blade failure at crystal rig

Details: HSW 250 kW throws blades
Title of the article: HS 250 KW throws blades

Details: The nacelle and blades of the turbine crashed to the ground from the 42 metre concrete tower. Nobody was injured.
Title of the article: Nacelle and rotor topple from tower

Details: The omission of a component in a cost-saving measure was responsible for the cascading disconnection of almost 600 turbines in February
Title of the article: Human error blamed for Chinese turbine shutdown

Details: Iberdrola stopped production at its 150MW wind farm at Rugby, North Dakota after the blades fell off

Details: A massive windfarm was shut down after a giant turbine blade broke and fell to the ground.

Details: A 46-metre blade has fallen off a Repower 2MW turbine at a project alongside the A10 motorway in France.

Details: A 50ft micro wind turbine was toppled because of 55mph gusts in the middle of the night.

Details: A falling section of a lattice tower used for wind measurements caused the death of a contract worker on Sunday at a Kenedy County wind farm, his employer said Tuesday.

Details: The fire was put out and no one was injured, according to a statement from the owner, Edison Mission Energy in Nebraska.
Title of the article: Wind turbine catches fire at Crofton Bluffs wind farm

Details: Technicians dispatched to the scene from TransAlta’s Pincher Creek maintenance depot discovered that one of the three black fibreglass blades had broken off while the turbine was generating power.

Details: The wind turbine model on which a 40m rotor blade snapped near Wonthaggi on the Mornington Peninsula this week has a history of failure in the US.
Title of the article: Worries at Victorian wind farm after rotor blade snaps

Details: A worker at the Macarthur wind farm, north of Warrnambool, in south-western Victoria, has been crushed in an industrial accident.
Title of the article: Victorian man injured on wind farm

Details: 68 tonne wind tower section reported rolled off the trailer onto the sidewalk on Pueblo Boulvard
Title of the article: Wind turbine falls from truck; Pueblo Blvd. traffic slows

Details: A wind turbine near Grafton caught fire Tuesday afternoon. The flames were pretty strong for a while as the smoke streamed from the tower. Fire crews didn't get too close at first because of burning debris falling down.
Title of the article: Another Wind Turbine Blaze: Fire Breaks Out At Iowa Wind Farm

Details: A wind farm worker is okay following a crane accident Sunday morning. A Winnebago County Sheriff's report confirms Billy Cody was trapped in a crane at the construction site located between Forest City and Thompson.

Details: Residents were left fearing for their safety after shards of melting ice fell on homes and gardens from the blades of a giant wind turbine.
Title of the article: Wind turbine's deadly ice shower

Details: A teenage windfarm worker died after plunging 100 feet down the inside of a turbine, it was revealed last night. The 19-year-old is believed to have fallen from near the top of the shaft.
Title of the article: Worker dies in fall from wind turbine; teenager's 100 ft  plunge inside shaft

Details: Crews are working to remove a tractor-trailer hauling a wind turbine from a ditch in Riley Township.
Title of the article: M-19 blocked by wind turbine

Details: Smoke pours from the top and bottom of one of the wind turbines at the Ewington Wind Farm near the Heron Lake exit north of Interstate 90 Wednesday (Mar 26) morning. The Brewster and Okabena Fire Departments responded to the scene, but upon the advice of Suzlon Wind Energy officials, the fire was allowed to burn itself out.
Title of the article: Turbine burns at Ewington wind farm

Details: A leak of flammable liquid from a drum caused a fire, resulting in evacuation of the workforce. The plant makes turbine blades.
Title of the article: Fire at LM Wind Power forces evacuation of 75

Details: Fire reported at wind turbine near McBain.

Details: 49-year old Lindsay Easton died after his crane left a hillside road while in convoy with other vehicles
Title of the article: Driver who died after 130-tonne crane crashes near Scout Moor wind farm is named

Details: A 65 ft blade that flew off the turbine came loose after bolts attaching it to the hub failed. after weeks of analysis the turbine manufacturer Enercon has released an interim report identifying material fatigue as the cause of the accident.
Title of the article: UFO wind turbine 'broke due to mechanical failure not collision with flying object'

Details: The turbine was destroyed as the region was battered by winds of up to 260km/h when a ferocious Atlantic storm powered into northern parts of the UK.
Title of the article: Why did a Scottish wind turbine explode in high winds?

Details: The Weekend Australian of March 24-25 reports that a wind turbine blade shattered in moderate wind conditions, flinging large pieces of debris over a wide area. A representative of the wind farm operator is reported as being mystified as to the cause of the accident and saying that the turbine blades were high quality and made by a leading Danish company. Locals called for the wind farm to be closed pending an investigation.
Title of the article: Wind turbine accidents and the threat to local workers

Details: A serious crane accident in Northern Germany involving the dropping of a large turbine rotor has been reported. The accident involved a 1,200 tonne Liebherr LTM11200-9.1 erecting a large wind turbine. Local news stations say that a violent and unexpected gust of wind caused the rotor to take- off pulling the crane's boom and Jib with it, causing it to collapse. The boom, jib and rotor with its blades came crashing to the ground.
Title of the article: Wind turbine accident in Germany

Details: A six-year-old Vestas V47 turbine toppled at Scottish Power's Beinn an Tuirc windfarm at Kintyre on November 8. The 200ft mast bent in half and crumpled to the ground after being hit by a 50mph gust.
Title of the article: Vestas Turbine collapse

Details: A three-year-old boy was killed in accident north of London, Ont., Saturday evening when the pole of a small wind turbine fell on him.
Title of the article: Boy dies in freak accident with wind turbine

Details: Gorran Primary School on the Roseland, has secured more than £50,000 from different agencies to carry out the work on the 15m (49ft) high turbine. On the afternoon of Friday, November 13, the school was advised to turn on the brakes to stop the turbine, but the brakes failed, causing two blades to detach in the early hours of Saturday morning.
Title of the article: Wind turbine FAIL – school left holding the bag for £53,000

Details: The 1.5MW turbine installed in northwest Xinjiang province was undergoing commissioning when a freak pick-up in wind speed sent the turbine to the ground.
Title of the article: Turbine collapse kills one, injures three at Chinese wind farm

Details: A giant wind turbine tower collapsed Saturday in Eastern Oregon, causing a worker to fall to his death and another man to be injured. The worker killed in the incident was at the top of a turbine tower when the support column holding the turbine buckled about halfway up and toppled over. The injured man was inside of the tower at the time while the third worker, who escaped injury, was at the base.
Title of the article: Man killed when wind tower collapses

Details:
A giant transporter carrying wind turbine components has closed a Northumberland road after crashing into a ditch. 
The surface of the A696 south of Otterburn was damaged as the turbine parts tumbled off the vehicle and on to adjoining land. It is believed the wheels had clipped the kerb just north of Ottercopse, toppling the transporter into the ditch.
Title of the article: A696 near Otterburn closed after turbine transporter crash

Details: A total of three men, including a Polish worker and a Swedish diver have already lost their lives whilst working on offshore wind farms 120 kilometres off the East Frisian coast near Emden
Title of the article: Killer Offshore Windparks – 3 Dead, 80 Serious Accidents “…More Have Died”

Details: The technician suffered third-degree burns to his neck, chest and arms and second-degree facial burns in the Oct. 20 accident at the Iberdrola Streator Cayuga Ridge South Wind Farm near Odell, Ill., the Labor Department said.
Title of the article: Wind Farm Safety Incident Brings Fine

Details: According to those at the scene, the worker, who has not been identified, had a crushed hand and was still at the top of the tower when crews arrived.
Title of the article: Worker Injured in Wind Turbine Accident

Details: A 25-year old Portland electrician was injured after a three kilogram object fell on his head from 15 metres while working inside a wind turbine at Macarthur this morning.
Title of the article: Portland electrician airlifted after wind turbine incident

Details: A man injured in a 60-foot fall while working on a wind turbine in November 2009 in Winnebago County has filed a lawsuit against the corporation that made the safety equipment he was using at the time. The lawsuit states when a worker is moving up and down a wind turbine ladder, the clips on the lanyard are to be attached to a harness and a cable sleeve to act as a brake to stop the worker during a fall to prevent injury. When Flack attempted to descend the ladder in the interior of the windmill tower, he lost his footing and slipped, falling about 60 feet and sustaining permanent and serious injuries, according to the lawsuit.
Title of the article: Federal lawsuit filed in Winnebago County wind turbine accident

Details: A semi hauling a wind turbine propeller was leaving the Grovertown Truck Stop to go east on US 30 and the load was completely across the westbound lanes and partially across the eastbound lanes of US 30. A westbound passenger car failed to see the semi pulling out onto the highway and drover under the semi-trailer that was carrying the propeller.The occupant of the passenger car died from the injuries he sustained in the crash.
Title of the article: 1 Dead in US 30 Crash with Wind Turbine Propeller

Details: on the Feb.24 Gansu Jiuquan wind farm massive grid disconnection accident, they called it China’s largest and most severely affecting the power grid wind power accident in the last few years. CNB Daily learned during their research that the accident was caused by “low voltage ride through capability” failure and power grid development falling behind new energies development.
Title of the article: Chinese wind farm power grid disconnection accident

Details: The damage occurred on Thursday night when, according to the Met Office wind speeds near Huddersfield peaked at 77mph during fierce storms which felled trees, tore off roof tiles and damaged power cables.
Title of the article: Wrecked by gales again as windfarms get £300,000 to switch off...in high winds

Details: A Ming Yang 1.5MW wind turbine collapsed in the course of commissioning, killing one and injuring three, on September 5 in north-west China's Xinjiang province. Ming Yang said that according to preliminary analysis, the tower fell because the foundation bolts were not properly fastened in the course of turbine installation.
Title of the article: Ming Yang turbine collapse kills one, injures three

Details: A trailer carrying a 115,000 pound base column for a wind turbine detached from the truck hauling it and rolled off Interstate 91 Southbound in Irasburg near the Orleans exit.
Title of the article: Truck carrying wind turbine tips on I-91

Details: No one was injured in the crash between two semi-tractor trailers this morning that caused more than $275,000 damage to a wind turbine propeller and restricted traffic for more than two hours.
Title of the article: Accident involving wind turbine blade causes $275,000 damage

Details: A 29-year-old male rigger (victim) died after falling between 20-40 feet during wind turbine tower construction. He was wearing, but not using, a safety belt and lanyard at the time of the incident.
Title of the article: Construction Worker Dies After Falling From a Wind Turbine Tower

Details: An axle on a trailer carrying a tower for a wind turbine collapsed and caused a traffic snarl in West Fargo. The incident began when one of six axles on the trailer collapsed, landing part of the tower section on the road.
Title of the article: Wind turbine accident snarls traffic in West Fargo

Details: Vulture accident in southern Crete. People collected the wounded animal and took it to hospital where it was diagnosed with a broken wing and a limp.
Title of the article: Vulture accident in southern Crete

Details: An Ivy Tech Community College faculty member died Wednesday after he fell from a tower on the Lafayette campus. Craig Porter, 36, was on the tower around 12 p.m. conducting a "rating exercise" with students when he fell between 60-70 feet.
Title of the article: Ivy Tech faculty member dies after fall from tower

Details: A commercial truck trailer transporting a wind turbine base hit an embankment and crashed into the Burnt River on Interstate 84 just east of Baker City Saturday, police said.
Title of the article: Semi hauling wind turbine base goes into river

Details: A turbine crashed on the island of Texel (North of Holland).
Title of the article: HOLLAND - wind turbine accident in marina

Details: A wind turbine component fell from the back of a truck during transportation to the Musselroe Wind Farm site overnight.
Title of the article: Wind turbine part falls on the roadway

Details: Stephen C. McAdams, 40, was killed Friday afternoon at a construction site about six miles northeast of Kimball, S.D., according to Lt. Alan Welsh with the South Dakota Highway Patrol. McAdams was standing next to a pickup truck and talking to an occupant inside when he was trapped by a tractor-trailer trying to maneuver around the truck, Welsh said. The driver of the tractor-trailer turned too sharply and its flatbed trailer loaded with rebar trapped McAdams against the truck and then ran him over
Title of the article: Wrightsville man killed in accident at South Dakota construction site

Details: The diesel fuel spilled into Lake Ontario near Wolfe Island around 9:30 a.m. Wednesday from a boat carrying equipment for a controversial wind turbine project.
Title of the article: Wind project ship spills fuel near Wolfe Island

Details: The 3.6 MW wind turbines arrive at Mostyn harbour, North Wales, directly by barge from Esbjerg, Denmark. The main tower is assembled first, followed by the turbine nacelle, hub and finally the three blades are fitted. It is thought that the incident involved one of the 80 tonne, 25 metre turbine top towers which was dropped during lifting.
Title of the article: Lifting incident at Mostyn Port

Details: An all-night black-out has had to be brought into force for the 22 homes on the isolated Shetland community, because of problems in the island's £1.5 million hydro and solar power schemes. Foula's three wind turbines have been out of action since Christmas, when 100mph winds damaged the blades ...Now islanders are back to relying on costly diesel generator until the faults can be rectified.
Title of the article: Green isle forced to revert to diesel

Details: Lightning claimed a “victim” Wednesday in rural Lake Benton, hitting and setting ablaze the blades of a Buffalo Ridge wind turbine

Details: A man working inside a wind turbine in Nolan County when it was struck by lightning Monday was listed in stable condition at a Sweetwater hospital, according to fire officials.

Details: Dick Hozeman (NL), atop nacelle
Title of the article: Deaths from Working with Wind Energy

Details: Leif Thomsen, & Kaj Vadstrup (DK), srvcng. rotor
Title of the article: Deaths from Working with Wind Energy

Details: Employee #1 was struck in the head by pipes being lowered into a windmill tower. Employee #1 later died due to a blood clot in the lungs.
Title of the article: Inspection: 304208507 - Stemen Drilling

Details: UNKNOWN
Title of the article: Deaths from Working with Wind Energy

Details: Parachutist on Fehmarn, Schleswig-Holstein (D)
Title of the article: Deaths from Working with Wind Energy

Details: While cleaning blades, unconfirmed
Title of the article: Deaths from Working with Wind Energy

Details: Boat operator decapitated by small machine, unconfirmed
Title of the article: Deaths from Working with Wind Energy

Details: A failure in one of the wind turbines owned by the Iberdrola company in the Pedregal Mountains, Esteiro (Muros), resulted in a forest fire that razed a hectare of the mountain.
Title of the article: Accident: A failure in a wind turbine caused a forest fire in Muros

Details: An explosion and fire at a wind farm under construction in northeast Nebraska has injured three workers. One man, who was atop a tower when a turbine exploded, received first- and second-degree burns in the fire Tuesday morning. Two others, who were nearby, were treated for smoke inhalation and released.
Title of the article: 3 workers injured in wind farm fire

Details: A wind turbine came crashing down near Western Reserve High School in Berlin Center on Sunday
Title of the article: Wind turbine crashes to ground

Details: A worker with GE Wind Services was involved in an industrial accident on Tuesday, May 15, 2012 at the Trent-Mesa Wind Farm, located east of Sweetwater and off of Adrian Road at County Road 131.
Title of the article: Industrial accident on wind farm

Details: Locally, Delabole was struck by lightning, damaging some of its rotors in its early days and a wind-farm at St. Clether (near Launceston) of 26 turbines commissioned in 1993 was closed down in Spring 2000 due to metal fatigue in its towers.
Title of the article: Wind-farm correspondence

Details: Plaintiff worked for Fayette as a turbine technician.She was injured on the job when she got her hand caught between the yaw pinion and the yaw gear of the wind turbine. At the time of the accident she was in the process of attempting to lock off a wind turbine so it could be repaired. She climbed the tower of the wind turbine and entered the work cage; seeing the yaw motor pivoting towards her and fearing it would strike her legs, she swung her legs out of the way and pushed off with her right hand. In so doing, her hand was caught in the yaw gear. Previously the turbine had been sold to the Sheinbergs by Fayette, who had manufactured it.
Title of the article: Behrens v. Fayette Manufacturing Co. (1992) 4 Cal. App. 4th 1567 [7 Cal. Rptr. 2d 264]

Details: In the instant lawsuit, plaintiff seeks damages for injuries suffered in a December 19, 2006 incident that occurred while plaintiff was employed by White Construction as a quality control manager at the Allegheny Ridge Wind Farm construction site. Defendant Gamesa Energy USA, LLC contracted with White Construction to unload, assemble, install and test wind turbines at the Allegheny site. See Resp. to Pl.’s Mot. to Compel at 1 (Doc. No. 30). Plaintiff asserts that the incident involved a “hazardous wind turbine electric hoist” designed, sold, manufactured, delivered and installed by defendants.
Title of the article: DAVIS v. GAMESA TECHNOLOGY CORPORATION, INC. et al - Document 37

Details: Aaron McCoy (“McCoy”), an Outland employee, suffered while performing maintenance services on a wind turbine. On October 20, 2010, McCoy and several other Outland technicians were working uptower in different turbines at Cayuga Ridge. The technicians were using the modified LOTO procedure rather than the standard LOTO procedure. When one technician radioed an Iberdrola technician to re-energize a wind turbine, the Iberdrola technician mistakenly powered up the turbine that McCoy was servicing. This resulted in an electrical explosion that caused McCoy’s injuries.
Title of the article: McCoy v. Gamesa Technology Corp. et al - Document 198

Details: Joshua David Poynor lost portions of two fingers when a propeller blade on a wind turbine he was servicing smashed his hand. He sued Mitsubishi Power Systems, alleging that the company’s negligence caused the injury. On August 12, 2009, Poynor was ordered by his supervisor to assist a Mitsubishi technician with rotating a turbine’s blades. The blades had to be adjusted before Lone Star could safely clean the turbine. At some point – the exact moment is unclear – Poynor’s hand was crushed by the machinery. He lost parts of two of his fingers.
Title of the article: Joshua Poynor v. Mitsubishi Power Sys Amer Inc.

Details: Plaintiffs claim that their injuries resulted from an accident involving a tractor-trailer-rig driven by Defendant Gregory Bonhomme and owned and operated by Defendant Clarke Road Transport, Inc. According to Plaintiffs, Bonhomme operated the tractor-trailer-rig with an oversized loaded wind turbine on it through a work or construction zone at an unsafe speed and manner. Plaintiffs claim that it improperly loaded the oversized turbine onto the trailer shortly before the accident and that the tractor-trailer-rig and oversized load were not properly inspected before the tractor-trailer-rig and oversized load departed Defendant Molded Fiber Glass Companies, L.P.’s Gainesville, Texas plant, or at any point before the wreck in question.
Title of the article: Varkey et al v. Clark Road Transport, Inc. et al - Document 54

Details: On November 21, 2004, during transit of the nacelle cargo from Texas to Illinois, Bay Machinery’s vehicle was allegedly involved in a motor vehicle accident in Crossroads, Arkansas, causing the nacelle cargo to sustain damage.
Title of the article: Codan Forsikring A/S v. ATS Logistics Services Inc - Justia

Details: This suit arises from a fire that damaged a portion of a wind turbine generator known as a nacelle. The generator, including the nacelle, was manufactured in India and shipped to the Port of Houston for inland shipment to Minnesota. The fire occurred after the nacelle had been unloaded from the ship and was undergoing preparations for transportation on a truck trailer. Those preparations included welding necessary to secure the nacelle to the trailer.
Title of the article: Suzlon Wind Energy v. Shipper’s Stevedoring Company

Details: One of the turbines on Kirby Moor (Cumbria) failed in impressive fashion subsequent to a lightning strike; the blades disintegrated hurling wreckage across the moor. Dilapidated remains of the glass fibre coating are all that remained on the blade tips. The nose cone was also blown off by the lightning strike.
Title of the article: Wind turbines are without doubt very dangerous contraptions

Details: In 1994 a number of longitudinal cracks were found on the blades of several of the 34 WindMaster 300 kW turbines in Greece
Title of the article: Protection sought in liquidation after blade failures in greece

Details: A blade cracked away from a 190ft turbine on a Sheffield University research park. Police evacuated the area while engineers allowed the 30ft blade to fall to the ground. The turbine was made by WES, a Dutch company. Earlier that month, the British government had published its renewable energy strategy - with plans to build around 4,000 new onshore wind turbines.
Title of the article: Spinning to destruction

Details: There was a spectacular, unexplained turbine collapse at a wind park in Kirtorf, Eastern Hesse, Germany, on Sunday, 19 June 2011.
Title of the article: German turbine collapse

Details: The agricultural pilot killed while seeding a field in the Delta likely never saw the steel tower that caused the fatal crash.
Title of the article: Pilot killed in wind tower crash

Details: Insufficient and irregular distribution of glue” caused large pieces to break off seven turbine blades at the Allegheny Ridge Wind Farm near Lilly, Cambria County.
Title of the article: Bad gluing blamed for mishaps at wind farm

Details: Turbine #10 at the Searsburg wind energy facility in Searsburg, Vermont experienced a catastrophic failure when one of the blades came in contact with the turbine's tower causing it to buckle during high winds.
Title of the article: Catastrophic turbine failure raises doubts about safety

Details: A 23 metre turbine blade, weighing some 3 tonnes, broke off and landed on the N245 road between Oudkarspel and Dirkshorn, Holland.
Title of the article: Turbine blade lands on main road (holland)

Details: Three Scottish windfarms were "switched off" yesterday after a massive turbine collapsed in high winds.
Title of the article: Alert after turbine collapses in high winds

Details: A problem seems to be the turbines catching fire; one of the most recent and significant fires was on December 23rd when one of the five 200ft wind turbines at the Nissan car plant in Sunderland caught fire," it says.
Title of the article: Wind farm accident photos show the risks, claims pressure group

Details: Newspaper report of a turbine accident near the provincial highway between the towns of Alkmaar and Schagen in NW Holland. One of the blades of a Vestas turbine, 3000 kgs and 23 meters in length, broke and landed next to the highway not hitting anyone though.
Title of the article: Blade throw in Holland

Details: A construction worker who fell 24 feet Friday morning had to be carefully lowered through a series of hatchways inside Hanover’s 210-foot wind turbine before being rushed to the hospital.
Title of the article: Worker in good condition after fall from Hanover wind turbine

Details: A wind turbine contractor was injured at the Twin Ridges Wind Farm in Wellersburg Tuesday afternoon when a large piece of steel fell on him.
Title of the article: Wind turbine worker injured near Wellersburg

Details: A company hired to do line work on a Makara wind farm had failed to get the relevant information on safely using a machine, which later toppled killing one man and seriously injuring another
Title of the article: Safety info lacking before wind farm death

Details: An unidentified construction worker suffered unspecified injuries Tuesday afternoon when he fell into a manhole while working on the windmill lead line project in the area of Green and Grant streets.
Title of the article: Construction worker injured in manhole fall

Details: An Austrian wind farm had to be closed after a blade snapped off one of the wind turbines, and fell over 100 metres to the ground.
Title of the article: Blade snaps off windmill

Details: A transporter lorry travelling in Northumberland northbound on the A696, Newcastle to Jedburgh road, carrying a component for a wind turbine, came off the road. It happened just south of Ravenscleugh Farm between Ottercops communication masts and Raylees
Title of the article: Turbine transport crash was ‘accident waiting to happen’

Details: A truck carrying a 131-foot-long wind blade from Aberdeen collided with two other semi trucks at the intersection of U.S. highways 281 and 212 north of  Redfield about 12:30 p.m. Wednesday, according to the South Dakota Highway Patrol.
Title of the article: 3 semis collide

Details: Part of a wind turbine blade weighing more than half a ton snapped off and crashed into a field during high winds. A chunk of the 18 metre (59 feet) long blade sheared off at the Cold Northcott windfarm on Bodmin Moor at about 9am yesterday.
Title of the article: Big Chunk Of Turbine Blade Shears Off

Details: The Tasmanian wind power company, Roaring 40s, says a wind turbine at its Woolnorth farm injured a wedge-tailed eagle two weeks ago. The eagle's wing was damaged and it had to be put down by a vet
Title of the article: Eagle put down after wind farm accident

Details: Vital maintenance work on Scroby Sands windfarm, off the Norfolk coast, has been interrupted after an accident involving the giant jack-up barge Sea Energy
Title of the article: Barge smashes into wind turbine

Details: A 19-year-old construction worker has been killed after falling 100ft down the shaft of a windfarm turbine.
Title of the article: Man dies after 100ft turbine fall

Details: A truck carrying a wind turbine scraped the underside of the overpass while trying to pass through. The truck likely hit the overpass because the load was "too high," explained provincial police spokesman Ronald McKinnis
Title of the article: Truck carrying wind turbine strikes Highway 15 overpass

Details: Locked turbine blades and an unplugged circuit board may have been behind the sequence of events that buckled a wind turbine tower and sent a technician plunging to his death.
Title of the article: Worker's wind tower death detailed

Details: A wind tower column from DMI Industries in West Fargo that was being hauled on a semitrailer flatbed clipped the underside of an Interstate 94 overpass just east of this city, damaging it.
Title of the article: Overpass damage near Casselton caused by wind tower

Details: Nordtank wind turbine at Halling in eastern Jutland experienced a so called runwaway event causing its blades to spin out of control. Minutes later the blades collided with the tower and caused the turbine to collapse.
Title of the article: Wind turbine collapse under investigation

Details: In an unrelated event at Vig in Odsherred a Vestas V47 600kW wind turbine lost a blade.
Title of the article: Wind turbine collapse under investigation

Details: ECCA Fire Chief Gary Young said the fire started in the wind turbine tower and then spread to grass around the tower.
Title of the article: Wind Turbine Erupts Into Flames Southwest Of Abilene

Details: Arlington, WY – avg annual wind speed of 31mph, gusts above 110mph,
Title of the article: Wind power gets bent out of shape in Wyoming

Details: Man, 26, installing turbine before fire broke out; 2 others injured
Title of the article: Sioux Falls utility worker dies in fall from Minnesota wind tower

Details: Fire material damage
Title of the article: Item 602 Additional Article

Details: Suzlon turbine explodes in Brazil
Title of the article: Item 603 Additional Article

Details: Fire in Australia
Title of the article: Item 605 Additional Article

Details: Fire in Texas
Title of the article: Electrical problem expected as cause in windmill fire

Details:
on September 28, 2008, Typhoon Jangmi struck Taiwan,
bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall that collapsed a wind turbine tower located
on the shore of Taichung Harbor. This study provides significant insights into, and lessons
learned from, post-disaster inspection into the causes of tower failure during this typhoon
Title of the article: Failure analysis and risk management of a collapsed large wind turbine tower

Details: Hornslet Wind Turbine Collapse was a spectacular collapse of a wind turbine on February 22, 2008. It is one of only a few structural collapses that have been captured on film.
Title of the article: Hornslet wind-turbine collapse

Details: A 329-foot wind turbine, base to blade tip, collapsed early Sunday morning, December 27, at the Fenner wind farm in Fenner, New York
Title of the article: Fenner wind turbine collapse, aerial image

Details: A fallen windmill switches off all others from grid too.
Title of the article: Umfaller im Windpark Ellenstedt in der Nähe von Vechta

Details: The machine - said to be one of the oldest in the county - came down between December 29-30 in high winds.
Title of the article: Probe into wind turbine collapse

Details: A blade tip hit the tower after the turbine's main axle broke in fair weather.
Title of the article: Turbine failure at Windpark Kreekraksluis under investigation

Details: A Repower Systems 2 MW turbine, newly installed for wind plant operator Jawe Konstrukt of Wesseling at a site near Herzogenrath, lost a blade tip during high winds in early September requiring a main road to be closed for several hours while the police investigated the incident and supervised any clearing of debris. "The blade, delivered by LM, was not the problem," says Repower's Thomas Schnorrenberg. "The fault appears to have been in the charger for the batteries operating the blade brakes and the sensor system that should have signalled that the batteries were not charged," he says.
Cause: Mechanical (the charger for the batteries operating the blade brakes)
Title of the article: Repower 2 MW wind turbine loses blade tip

Details: significant amounts of metal were found in the gearbox oil filter housing and significant internal damage was observed with a borescope. The filter element was replaced on May 25, and the turbine was returned to service. The turbine was removed from service on June 18, 2012 after significant additional metal was discovered in the filter housing.
Title of the article: Gearbox Failure Investigation

Details: In the incident at the Paulding County wind farm, a Vestas turbine suffered a blade shear in the spring. EverPower informed the OPSB that it eliminated the Vestas brand turbine as a potential company from which to purchase turbines for the proposed Champaign Wind project.
Title of the article: EverPower employee asked about shadow flicker, blade failure

Details: They expressed fury at the failure and damage to the turbines on Hobart’s waterfront Marine Board building on August 11, coming after the council had included safety concerns in its opposition to the turbines.
Title of the article: Call to probe turbine failure

Details: The Coldingham wind turbine brought to the ground due to safety fears last week suffered mechanical failure, according to police and the company which installed it.
Title of the article: Turbine brought down due to mechanical failure

Details: The blade were hit by lighting.
Title of the article: Wind farms withstand winter storms

Details: Around 35 MW of turbines destroyed in a cyclone in Gujarat.
Title of the article: Changing the tide of misfortune

Details: A Zond nacelle and rotor in Northern Ireland fell from their tower during hurricane force winds which hit the province on December 26.
Title of the article: Winds blow turbine from tower

Details: Five Enercon E40 machines in Hesse have failed this year. The nacelles of two machines recently crashed to the ground, both suffering from a failed "kingpin," a cast iron component used to attach the nacelle to the turbine tower. The material of the failed component in each case was sub-standard, says Enercon.
Title of the article: Material fault identified

Details: A fire in one of the 19 NedWind 1 MW wind turbines at the Eemmeerdijk wind farm in Zeewolde led to a temporary shut down of the whole plant in December, shortly after it went on line in November. The fire broke out on Christmas day, apparently the result of a fault in the grid connection of one turbine, causing it to short circuit, says NedWind's Theo Alsemgeest.
Title of the article: Turbine fire at Eemmeerdijk

Details: Two blade failures on NEG Micon 1.5 MW turbines in February at the Sustrum/Renkenberge wind station in Emsland, Germany.
Title of the article: Lightning damages wood epoxy blades

Details: A 40 metre blade split apart on a new Zond Z-750 wind turbine near Palm Springs in winds of about 40 mph.
Title of the article: Zond blade failure in Palm Springs

Details: The failure involved a Vestas 225 kW turbine, a model manufactured in large numbers in the early 1990s, at Falkenberg on the west coast. After becoming detached from the hub for reasons not known, the blade fell to the ground at the base of the tower.
Title of the article: Europe: Flying blades to be investigated

Details: The lost blade was from an 18-metre wind turbine from Liten Vindkraft, a little known Swedish make. It was installed in the centre of Malmo but collapsed a few hours after being turned on.
Title of the article: Europe: Flying blades to be investigated

Details: Storm force winds with gusts claimed to be as high as 55 metres per second (m/s) tore the nacelle, rotor and two tower sections from a 660 kW Gamesa Eólica G-47 turbine at Palencia in the Spanish province of Castile and León in early January.
Title of the article: Extreme winds topple turbine -- Twice in two months for Gamesa

Details: In December in Merindades, a G-47 tower was fractured, apparently struck by a blade and again in high winds, though Gamesa declines to comment further on this incident.
Title of the article: Extreme winds topple turbine -- Twice in two months for Gamesa

Details: On March 2, average wind speeds at the Sierra Cabrera wind farm in Valencia were measured at 140 kilometres per hour (39 m/s), with gusts as strong as 180 km/h (50 m/s), according to Gamesa Eólica's Javier Perea. The winds brought down part of the rotor and generator of a 850 kW unit. The turbine was still awaiting grid connection and was not able to yaw out of the wind, says Perea.
Title of the article: Third Gamesa storm victim since December

Details: Mr Jones suffered multiple injures and was left paralysed when part of the wind turbine fell on him at the Brithdir Mawr farm near Newport in Pembrokeshire in October 2001.
Title of the article: Soundman wins BBC damages claim

Details: A turbine propeller blade has folded in half at the UK's first electricity-generating offshore wind farm, at Blyth, in Northumberland.
Title of the article: Wind farm closed after blade snaps

Details: NEG Micon has started work replacing the nacelle on one of its offshore turbines at Yttre Stengrund in Sweden which burnt out in March. The fire, one of the first recorded at an offshore wind installation, was caused by loose connections between the transformer's connection bars and the power cables from the generator circuit breaker.
Cause: Mechanical (loose connections between the transformer's connection bars and the power cables from the generator circuit breaker)
Title of the article: Burned out generator replaced

Details: The loss of an entire rotor and hub from an NEG Micon 500 kW turbine in Germany last month was the result of an extraordinary material failure following welding work by a sub-contractor, reports the machine's manufacturer. A rupture of the main shaft was "clearly induced by a repair procedure causing weakening" of the material and "inadequate quality of the repair itself," states NEG Micon.
Title of the article: One-off NEG Micon turbine failure blamed on subcontractor

Details: The fire, in early July, burnt out the nacelle, rotor and the uppermost section of the three part, 67 metre tower.
Title of the article: Fire in Vestas turbine prompts wind farm retrofit

Details: Wind plant operators in France's overseas tropical territories are counting the costs and learning the lessons of dealing with tropical storms after Cyclone Erica struck the islands of New Caledonia on March 14.  Plum, consisting of 20 Vestas V27 and V29 turbines operated by the utility Electricité et Eau de Calédonie (EEC) suffered far more damage.
Title of the article: Cyclone Erica puts turbines to the test

Details: On May 23, 2003 at the Mountaineer wind farm in the Allegheny Mountains, at least 33 birds were killed. Some of the deaths were attributed to collisions with wind turbines and some to collisions with a substation.
Title of the article: Massive bird kill at West Virginia wind farm highlights national issue

Details: Bat kills are emerging as a major and unexpected problem at wind turbine sites in the United States. The issue was brought to a head last month after the death of what scientists describe as an "alarming" and "surprising" number of bats in a single wind farm over what appears to be the course of about four weeks, starting August 19. At least 250 bats died in that period at the Mountaineer Wind Farm on Backbone Mountain in West Virginia.
Title of the article: Alarming evidence of bat kills in eastern US -- Scientists call on wind industry to help solve mystery of serious level of bat mortality at wind turbine sites

Details: Investigation into the fall of a GE 1.5 MW turbine at the 49.5 MW Caluengo wind plant in Navarra discards the possibility of a series fault. "The fault has been located to the electrical feed device of the turbine's electronic pitch control system," says Derna.
Title of the article: No series fault concludes investigation into toppled GE Wind 1.5 MW unit in Navarra

Details: The transformer breakdowns on 14 of 20 Bonus turbines started within three months of the Middelgrund wind station starting operation off the Copenhagen coastline in May, 2001. The most recent failure occurred on December 23, 2004, on a turbine that Siemens had already retrofitted with a new transformer in December 2001.
Title of the article: Offshore plant owners sue supplier of transformers -- Shareholders' resort to court action against Siemens and others

Details: A crop duster hit a tower and crashed into a Crosby County cotton field Thursday morning, killing the pilot, Federal Aviation Administration officials said.
Title of the article: Ransom Canyon pilot dies in Crosby County crop-dusting accident

Details: The windfarm is obviously situated on the top of a hill with no wires or roads nearby and the horrendous injury, in which the end portion of the wing was almost severed, is considered by the vet who examined the kite, to be wholly in keeping with being hit by a turbine blade.
Title of the article: Red Kite Critically Injured By Wind Turbine

Details: During the winter 05/06, over 100 ice fragments could be recorded and analyzed.
Title of the article: Wind turbine ice throw case studies in the swiss alps

Details: A man was struck by a fork lift as he worked on the Barton Windmill Project, just North of Grafton in Worth County. Dick Hamilton, 46 of Tishmingo, Oklahoma was hit when the driver of an all terrain, Caterpillar fork lift didn't see him on October 9.
Title of the article: Fines for deadly Worth County windfarm accident

Details: A semi tractor trailer travels westbound on I-8, passing the wind farm on the Campo Indian Reservation, back in October 2009. Lightning struck the power towers during a fierce storm on Monday, Dec. 07, 2009, causing some damage.
Title of the article: Lightning damages East County wind turbines

Details: One of the blades of a Suez Energy North America V-90 wind turbine situated approximately 1,600 feet away, between her house and the Northumberland Strait, was damaged. Pieces were dangling from the blade and other pieces were strewn throughout a field, right up to her back door
Title of the article: Storm damages wind turbine

Details: The wind storm that knocked over the crane had similar negative effects on the local residential wind-powered electric generators. The storm, which blew at least 125 miles per hour, completely dislodged the helix shaped turbine that was installed on Haystack hill. The blades and shaft blew away and were later located by divers. The tower stayed up.
Title of the article: 125 mph winds blow away Unalaska wind turbine

Details: The top half of one of the 100-foot windmills, with its broken turbine and missing blades, lies on the ground at the PMLD wind site.
Title of the article: Windmill topples on Wachusett Mountain

Details: The discovery of four mangled white tailed eagles over a four month period at Norway's largest wind power station at Smøla is causing international concern among bird protection groups worried about future wind power development and the fate of sensitive bird populations.
Title of the article: Concern over eagle kills in Norway -- Discovery by British bird group

Details: A big fire broke out at a 2MW wind-power unit at Chettikulam in Tirunelveli district, reportedly the biggest in Asia, causing a loss of about Rs two crore.
Title of the article: Fire in Chettikulam wind-power unit

Details: Longyuan Electric Power's coastal 15.85 MW Hedingshan wind farm in East China's Zhejiang Province suffered heavy damage after being swept by Typhoon Saomai and winds of 67 m/s in mid August. One Vestas 660 kW and two Windey 750 kW machines were toppled.
Title of the article: Typhoon damage affects Hedingshan wind farm in East China

Details: Longyuan Electric Power's coastal 15.85 MW Hedingshan wind farm in East China's Zhejiang Province suffered heavy damage after being swept by Typhoon Saomai and winds of 67 m/s in mid August. One Vestas 660 kW and two Windey 750 kW machines were toppled.
Title of the article: Typhoon damage affects Hedingshan wind farm in East China

Details: Super Typhoon Saomai almost destroyed the coastal Cangnan Wind Farm in August 2006, damaging 20 of its 28 turbines.
Title of the article: China Special - Offshore: Donghai litmus test for offshore plan

Details: A routine wind plant installation in America's heartland took an unnerving hit recently from a small tornado, which whipped through the construction site and damaged blades waiting for installation.
Title of the article: Tornado trouble at construction site -- A lesson from Kansas winds

Details: A Scots wind turbine firm has put out an alert after part of a turbine fell off at a school. The school lost its green energy supply after a damper, used to control the blades, came off when bolts broke.
Title of the article: Alert after turbine breakdown

Details: In the early morning hours of August 16, workers on a shallow-water oil and gas production platform in the Gulf of Mexico were transferring a heaving piece of equipment from the platform to a workboat. Suddenly the crane collapsed, triggering a tragic series of events that resulted in the death of one worker
Title of the article: COLLAPSED OFFSHORE PLATFORM CRANE KILLS WORKER

Details: At 3 o’clock in the morning of 26 March 1945, even though the wind on Grandpa’s Knob was light, one of the 8 ton blades broke off and went whirling through the air landing 225 m down the hillside.
Title of the article: Technological Trajectories in the Making: Two Case Studies from the Contemporary History of Wind Power

Details: Generating a total of 2.2 GWh with an annual record of 367 MWh in 1964, the Gedser Wind Turbine continued in routine operation until 1967 when the gearing broke.
Title of the article: Technological Trajectories in the Making: Two Case Studies from the Contemporary History of Wind Power

Details: Fragments of blade scattered across the field.
Title of the article: Shrapnel from a wind turbine

Details: Of the 36 turbines erected off Herne Bay - on the Kentish Flats - 12 have experienced gearbox problems.
Title of the article: Gearbox fault halts wind turbines

Details: The 62-tower Woolnorth farm has killed up to 18 of the island's endangered subspecies of the wedge-tail in its giant rotor blades.
Title of the article: Green power is black hole for rare eagles

Details: Clipper Windpower Inc.'s 2.5-MW Liberty wind turbines at the 20-MW Steel Winds facility in Lackawanna, N.Y., are malfunctioning due to faulty gear sets
Title of the article: Clipper's 2.5-MW Liberty wind turbines malfunction

Details: According to NedPower Mount Storm spokesperson Tim O'Leary, a wind turbine in Mount Storm caught fire at approximately 5:15 p.m. on Tuesday afternoon. According to O'Leary, the fire occurred during routine maintenance and started in the nacelle of the wind turbine.
Title of the article: Mt. Storm turbine catches fire

Details: A cable that brings power ashore from an offshore windfarm has failed and needs to be replaced in the spring.
Title of the article: Repair plan for offshore windfarm

Details: A worker was treated in hospital for burns caused by an electrical flash while working to repair those cables
Title of the article: Repair plan for offshore windfarm

Details: The blade fell on the windshield of a car.
Title of the article: Blade meets windshield

Details: One of the massive turbines at the sprawling Prince Wind Energy Project, immediately northwest of the city limits, was damaged during the Jan. 30 blizzard, which, according to Environment Canada, carried maximum wind gusts of 102 kilometres an hour.
Title of the article: Winds too much for turbine

Details:
The ferry Riverdance went out of control. Several rescue attempts were made 
by both boat and helicopter with all persons on board being airlifted off leaving 
a skeleton crew on board. This skeleton crew was unable to control the boat, 
and the Riverdance was beached on Blackpool Beach.
Cause: Human (crew was unable to control the boat)
Title of the article: Offshore wind capital grant scheme

Details: A wind turbine caught fire in Birds Landing early Monday, but investigators have yet to identify what caused the flames.
Title of the article: Fire ruins turbine at wind farm; Birds Landing blaze gutted 1 of 90

Details: An exclusion zone is in place around a Furness wind farm after gale force winds battered Cumbria. Pencil Lane at Marton has been closed off since Monday evening as engineers work to fix a mechanical failure on a turbine at Askam and Ireleth Wind Farm.
Title of the article: Exclusion zone around wind farm after gales

Details: The strong winds that buffeted the Tokai and Kanto regions Tuesday apparently snapped the massive blades of two wind turbines in Higashi-Izucho, Shizuoka Prefecture, officials of the company that operates the turbines said.
Title of the article: Windmills lose blades in high winds

Details: A 29-year-old contractor for Global Windpower Services fell 50 to 60 feet inside the shaft of a wind turbine on Wednesday, breaking ribs and a leg, rescue officials said.
Title of the article: Man injured after fall inside wind turbine

Details: Authorities say 38 year-old Glen Forbes was driving a trailer loaded with wind turbine blades when the rear steering malfunctioned. The Sac County, Iowa Sheriff's office says they're investigating what caused a semi to start a chain reaction accident that sent a utility pole into an Early, Iowa restaurant.
Title of the article: Truck driver sends utility pole into restaurant

Details: Fire caused an estimated $750,000 in damage to a windmill on Thursday, the Palm Springs Fire Deparment said today. Firefighters were called out about 5:55 p.m. to Windmill Farms a mile south of Interstate 10. The top portion of the windmill was on fire and several small spot fires happened because of falling debris. The fire is under investigation.
Title of the article: Windmill fire causes $750,000 in damage

Details: A truck carrying part of a large wind turbine damaged some girders at the Highway 60 and 65 interchange around ten Friday morning.

Details: punishing gale broke apart a research ship launched in March to study Delaware's offshore wind power resources, forcing the Coast Guard to rescue two crewmen from the sinking vessel. The Peterson, a former Gulf Coast oil industry service boat, was christened March 29 and sent to sea to support Bluewater Wind LLC's efforts to build a 150-turbine offshore wind farm in Atlantic waters east of Delaware.
Title of the article: 2 rescued as research vessel sinks off Rehoboth

Details: A farmer has described the shocking moment a 16-foot wind turbine blade smashed through the roof of his home as his family slept inside.

Details: The bridge has been closed since late June after a truck hauling a propeller wing for a wind power turbine in west Texas slammed into one of the bridge abutments. Engineers say it will be impossible to repair the bridge.
Title of the article: Ralph Fair Road bridge will have to be replaced

Details: There was a lightning strike that fried some components last year, but we believe this time it's an electrical circuit inside the control room that blew out, Const. Paul Calder of the Cumberland RCMP said recently.

Details: The two-year study found 90 per cent of the studied bats found dead below turbines near Pincher Creek suffered severe injuries to their respiratory systems consistent with a sudden drop in air pressure that occurs near the turbine blades.
Title of the article: Wind turbines to blame for bat deaths: study

Details: On Sept. 25, a truck carrying the base for a large wind turbine failed to exit the freeway, damaging the Exit 40 overchange bridge.

Details: A six-year-old Vestas V47 turbine toppled at Scottish Power's Beinn an Tuirc windfarm at Kintyre on November 8. The 200ft mast bent in half and crumpled to the ground after being hit by a 50mph gust.
Title of the article: Vestas Turbine collapse
